ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:0.5_0: 41. The training rule on naked ascetics
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī in the hall with the peaked roof in the Great Wood.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.1.2_0: At that time the Sangha was receiving an abundance of non-staple food.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.1.3_0: Venerable Ānanda told the Buddha, who said, “Well then, Ānanda, give the pastries to those who take leftovers.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.1.4_0: “Yes, Sir.” Ānanda had them to sit in a row and gave them one pastry each, until he accidentally gave two to a female wanderer.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.1.5_0: The female wanderers sitting next to her said to her, “This ascetic is your lover.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.1.6_0: “I don’t approve of this ascetic, sometimes promis.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.1.8_0: And a third time Ānanda gave them one pastry each, until he accidentally gave two to that same female wanderer.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.1.9_0: The female wanderers sitting next to her said to her, “This ascetic is your lover.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.1.10_0: “I don’t approve of this ascetic, sometimes promis.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.1.11_0: they didn’t urge them to be born.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.1_0: A certain Ājīvaka ascetic, too, went to that distribution of food.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.2_0: A monk mixed rice with a large amount of ghee and gave him a large lump.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.4_0: A certain Ājīvaka ascetic said to him, “What has you received any almsfood?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.5_0: “From the food distribution of the ascetic Gotama, that shaven-headed householder.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.6_0: Some lay followers overheard that conversation between those Ājīvaka ascetics.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.7_1: After bowing down to the Buddha, they sat down,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.7_2: and told him what was happening.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.8_0: “Venerable Sir, these ascetics of other religions want to disparage the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.9_0: It would be good if the monks didn’t give anything to the ascetics of other religions from their own hands.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.10_0: Then the Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired those lay followers with a Dhamma talk.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.10_1: After the Buddha had instructed, inspired, and gladdened those lay followers with a teaching, they got up from their seats, bowed down, circumambulated him with their right side toward him, and left.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.11_0: who gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.12_0: “Well then, monks, I will lay down a training rule for the following ten reasons:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.13_0: for the well-being of the Sangha, for the comfort of the Sangha, for the restraint of bad people, for the ease of well-behaved monks, for the restraint of corruptions relating to the present life, for the restraint of corruptions relating to future lives, to give rise to confidence in those without it, to increase the confidence of those who have it, for the longevity of the true Teaching, and for supporting the training.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.14_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.15.1_0: ‘If a monk gives staple or non-staple food to a naked ascetic, to a male wanderer, or to a female wanderer with his own hands, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.1.2_0: and you have the same kind of perception ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.1.4_0: ... The monks who have been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.1.8_0: any wanderer apart from Buddhist monks and novice monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.1.10_0: any nun who has never committed any trainee nun shouldn’t be given away by a novice nun.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.1.12_0: apart from the five staple foods, water, and tooth cleaners, the rest is called “non-staple food”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.1.14_0: there are five kinds of staple food: cooked grain, porridge, flour, fish, and meat.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.1.16_0: if she gives by body or by what is connected to the body or by releasing, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.2.1_0: If it is an ascetic of another religion, and he perceives them as such, and he gives them staple or non-staple food with his own hands, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.2.2_0: If it is an ascetic of another religion, but he is unsure of it, and he gives them staple or non-staple food with his own hands, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.2.3_0: If it is an ascetic of another religion, but he does not perceive them as such, and he gives them staple or non-staple food with his own hands, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.2.4_0: If he gives water or tooth cleaners, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.2.5_0: If it is not an ascetic of another religion, but he perceives them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.2.6_0: If it is not an ascetic of another religion, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.2.7_0: If it is not an ascetic of another religion, and he does not perceive them as such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.3.2_0: if she has someone else give it and does not give herself;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.3.3_0: if she gives by placing it near the person;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.3.4_0: if she gives ointments for external use;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.3.7_0: The first rule, the training rule on naked ascetics, is finished.
